Key Match Events: Zack Wheeler pitched an amazing game but did not get the run support.
The Mets came alive in the eighth inning.
Kyle Schwarber hit a lead-off home run in the first inning.
Pre-Game Insights: Fans partied outside the Bank and tailgated before Game 1 of the National League Division Series.
The stadium changes to all red during Red October.
Post-Match Reflections: Phillies fans were deflated and disappointed after losing to the New York Mets.
Aiden Oraphilly expressed resilience, stating the series isn't over.
Brandon Shields mentioned the bullpen did not help much.
Diamond Shields emphasized that the Phillies can still win in the end.
Alron Oz stated that Game 1 is nothing and they just need to get the job done.
Jade Charokopos believes Philly is great under pressure and can still come back.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Fans can get an early start on building energy with another block party starting Sunday at 1 p.m.
The team will give away more rally towels at the gates for Game 2.
